exhaust.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to make someone feel extremely tired
exhaust.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: A full day’s teaching exhausts me.
He’d exhausted himself carrying all the boxes upstairs.
exhaust.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: We are in danger of exhausting the world’s oil supply.
Having exhausted all other possibilities, I asked Jan to look after the baby.
exhaust.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a pipe on a car or machine that waste gases pass through
exhaust.translation[1].definitions[1].de: the gas produced when an engine is working
exhaust.translation[2].definitions[0].de: if you exhaust a supply of something, you use it all, so that there is none left
exhaust.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The museum was unable to buy the painting as its funds were exhausted by the purchase of two huge albums of eighteenth-century architectural drawings.
exhaust.translation[2].definitions[1].de: to take all the natural supplies of something from a place such as a mine so that there is none left
exhaust.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: Cut-and-run logging is expected to exhaust the primary rainforest by the end of the decade.
